intro: Sideroxylon randii, commonly known as the Madagascar ironwood, is a deciduous tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood that is highly valued for its durability. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native environment. Due to its unique characteristics and ecological importance, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
